page.title: 11THE MUSEUM OF CLOCKS,TOTLAND
page.content:
In the West Wight there is a clock museum.It used to be an old house,but it has been converted into a museum. The house was built in 1901 and it has been a museum for 4 years.There are about 200 clocks including the watches. The oldest clock was made in 1590.The French bubble clock has a matching wall bracket.The Dutch Marquet long case clock has a Dutch striking movement with alarm.The owner of the museum mends his clocks on the premises.Dr Hooke,who was responsible for inventing the hairspring lived only two miles away from the museum.
Lynn Collinson 9 years
